applications.name: PredictorIQ: AI Analytics & Copilot for Prediction Markets on Arbitrum
applications.grantAmount:
PredictorIQ aligns with Arbitrum’s ecosystem goals by strengthening DeFi usability and expanding the set of high-quality, data-driven applications available on the chain.

Prediction markets represent an underdeveloped but strategically important vertical in DeFi. While Arbitrum already offers strong infrastructure and a sophisticated user base, this vertical lacks dedicated intelligence and analytics tools. PredictorIQ addresses this gap by making prediction markets more accessible, efficient, and professional for serious users.

By anchoring access control, usage tracking, and future composable integrations on Arbitrum, PredictorIQ brings recurring onchain activity that goes beyond simple subscription payments. The project encourages users to stay active within the Arbitrum ecosystem as they research, monitor, and act on prediction markets, and it provides a foundation for other Arbitrum-native applications to consume prediction-market intelligence.

Over time, this positions Arbitrum as a natural home for prediction-market tooling and analytics, helping expand the ecosystem into a new DeFi vertical rather than competing with existing ones.

Aethercycle
applications.grantAmount:
We are requesting a grant of $50,000 USD.

This amount is not an arbitrary figure but is based on a strategic allocation of capital required to ensure that AetherCycle launches on Arbitrum with the highest standards of security, transparency, and community engagement. The funds will be allocated across three critical, non-negotiable pillars for a successful mainnet deployment:

Professional Security Audits ($25,000): Our top priority is security. This portion of the grant will be dedicated to engaging one or more top-tier security firms to conduct an exhaustive audit of our entire 15+ smart contract suite, with a particular focus on the novel ERC-vTOKEN implementation.

Final Integration & Pre-Launch Development ($15,000): This will fund our development team for a concentrated 2-month period dedicated to finalizing the integration of the ERC-vTOKEN standard, performing rigorous end-to-end testing on the Arbitrum Sepolia testnet, and implementing any necessary revisions based on pre-audit feedback.

Community Education & Go-to-Market Strategy ($10,000): AetherCycle introduces new paradigms (AutonoFi & vTOKENs) that require clear and comprehensive education. This budget will be used to create high-quality technical documentation (GitBook), tutorials, articles, and to bootstrap our initial community management efforts, ensuring the Arbitrum community fully understands the protocol's value from day one.

This strategic funding will bridge the final gap between our production-ready code and a secure, well-supported, and successful launch that brings immediate and lasting value to the Arbitrum ecosystem.

applications.name: A Living Archive of Human Experiences: Cultural Infrastructure on Arbitrum
applications.grantAmount:
Given the traction we’ve already achieved, the maturity of our team, and the infrastructure we’ve built, we believe a $600K grant is the right fit. This isn’t a speculative proposal or an early-stage experiment—it’s a proven initiative with real products already in the market, live users, and tangible outcomes. Unlike many grant recipients who require months to execute, we’re in a position to deploy capital immediately, with measurable impact within weeks as we scale into new cities and expand the Checkpoint network.

Our contribution to the Arbitrum ecosystem goes far beyond product development. We bring high-quality user acquisition through real-world cultural channels, drive consistent userops volume through verified, human-first activity, and unlock branding opportunities that position Arbitrum as the home for meaningful, non-speculative social interaction. Whether your mandate is to grow unique wallet addresses, increase onchain transactions, or deepen Arbitrum’s cultural relevance, our work directly supports those goals with unmatched authenticity and reach.

applications.name: Guava Nexus: Transforming Ideas into Tangible Value Assets through Event Tickets
applications.grantAmount:
We are requesting $26,500 USD to support the development of the Guava Nexus MVP. This funding will primarily be allocated towards the development of the protocol, including the MAD Ticketing system, Seed NFT minting, and the $Future token reward mechanism. This will lay the foundation for Guava Nexus to facilitate Web3 onboarding and incentivize participation through its unique clarity-driven model.

In addition to this request, we are also seeking funding under the Arbitrum Education, Community Growth and Events 3.0 program to fully support our Growth Strategy, which includes the distribution of MAD Tickets within various Web3 educational events. With this additional funding, the budget for Event Integration, Marketing, and Community Building will be minimized, as we focus most of the budget on the development of the Guava Nexus protocol. The focus of the $26,500 USD grant will be on ensuring the core infrastructure is robust, secure, and scalable for future applications.

The requested $26,500 USD will cover the following key areas:

	1.	Smart Contract Development:
	•	Building the MAD Ticketing system to facilitate Seed NFT minting and $Future token rewards.

	2.	Event Integration:
	•	Hosting micro-events (workshops, hackathons, meetups) to engage Web3 newcomers and developers, while minimizing the budget for event-based activities due to additional funding under the Arbitrum Education, Community Growth, and Events 3.0 program.

	3.	Platform Infrastructure:
	•	Development of frontend and backend systems to ensure a smooth and engaging user experience.

	4.	Security Audits:
	•	Conducting independent audits to validate the Seed NFT minting process and the $Future token reward system.

	5.	Marketing and Community Building:
	•	Allocating a minimal budget for community outreach and educational efforts, with the bulk of the effort being supported through TAMAD XYZ and the Arbitrum Education, Community Growth, and Events 3.0 grant.

This funding will enable us to successfully launch the MVP, test tokenomics, and build the foundation for scaling Guava Nexus, with a long-term vision to apply the Seed NFT model to larger-scale community events like the Future Dance Music Festival.

applications.fundingAsk: {"blocks":[{"key":"5jk32","text":"Summary","type":"header-one","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cfs7","text":"Kapan Finance is a lending aggregator, currently available in early access unaudited at https://kapan.finance only on Arbitrum. It is focused on the borrower experience and providing unified access to lending protocols. Currently it supports Aave, Compound and Venus with their basic loan related functionality. However the main thing the protocol aims to enable is removing the debt lock of users by allowing migration of loans and collateral through flash loans. This is all already implemented and next on the roadmap is a Starknet deployment after which the project will begin work on cross chain functionality and general chain abstraction. Think moving loans between chains, being able to borrow from anywhere and use the funds on a destination chain. Basically the traditional term for this is debt refinancing and exists in traditional banking, but not DeFi. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":465,"length":31,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":758,"length":109,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14g6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lcne","text":"Why is the project beneficial for users?","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32ui2","text":"Liquidity on lending protocols is quite fragmented and differenes in usage cause the utilization rates to spike. This has lead to some unmaintainable loans at times with the APR spiking to the highest i've seen of 50% on usdc in a certain day, while maintaining averages of 8-10% which is higher than traditional banks. It has been brought down recently, but the issue with the APR spiking on a lending protocol is that it's not this high on another protocol, but users have no easy way of migrating between them. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m73u","text":"Venus for example has 10% (current 8.68%) usdt APR while Compound has ~4% (current 3.67%) and those are annual averages. While some users might prefer staying on Venus, some might be locked in","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3e6m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4a3f","text":"There are a few projects with limited migration implementation (DefiSaver, Instadapp), but they require you to migrate to a smart wallet which means you have to go through them for your continued access to the lending funds. On the other hand some lending protocols maintain position migrators, but they dont even support all their markets and are greatly outdated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p3sn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f4r","text":"You might think - \"But what's so hard about repaying debt, taking out the collateral and moving to another place to get the debt again?\" and the answer to this is that debt is often used off chain and users do not have the funds to repay and move, locked in contracts for a certain amount of time. A lot of yield protocols use a time lock on withdrawals, which means users would have to wait it out. And even if there was no time lock its burdensome figuring out where to pull liquidity from in order to come up with the debt. Kapan solves this using Balancer flash loans and a completely non custodial contract, which means that once the debt is migrated from Aave to Compound for example, the users can go on Compound and use it directly. There is no need to stick to Kapan. The flow being structured to work for both EOA and contracts also means the protocol is usable by DAOs and other dapps who need to refinance their loans. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":19,"length":116,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjnln","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jtin","text":"TLDR; Kapan provides pure utility to users and implements features that lending protocols lack or fail to maintain. This is all done for free and there are no plans to charge any fees on local transfers ever as they do not make any sense whatsoever and would limit the mobility of users. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abb0","text":"Why is this project beneficial for protocols?","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj1sv","text":"Kapan aims to provide unified access to lending protocols through a common smart contract interface and website. This means in practice that protocols who want to migrate debt to arbitrum or even fully migrate/deploy can do so without figuring out underlying details. For example there might be a dapp that provides on chain shorting or leverage on top of a lending protocol which is not available on arbitrum. It can use Kapan to both access protocols available on arbitrum along with migrate users who wish to do so. Or migrate its vaults. All without having to figure out underlying details. While this objective is very far down the road, everything so far is designed with it in mind. Having the Arbitrum DAO back Kapan certainly increases the chances of its adoption and consequent usage by protocols to deploy to arbitrum, which in turn is beneficial to arbitrum's users. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eujm8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vd8a","text":"The flow","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d3g4","text":"User approves collateral to be moved by the contract, delegates debt to it and sends a transaction to Kapan's Router. Kapan's router takes a flash loan, repays the debt on behalf of the user and moves the collateral to the destination protocol, taking debt on behalf of the user and repaying the flash loan. The net result is that the user has the same debt and same collateral in one atomic transaction with no fees paid as the balancer flash loan is free.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":409,"length":47,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"714mp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"121aq","text":"The cross chain flow","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3prf","text":"Nearly identical except there is no flash loan available cross chain, which means the protocol must maintain liquidity around the chains in order to repay the debt and move the collateral. Instead of directly depositing to another protocol it would go through an intent bridge calling Kapan on the destination chain, which then facilitates the deposit of collateral + borrow and sends back the borrowed amount to repay the liquidity. The one major difference is that approvals can be revoked while the collateral travels. If kapan is not able to finalize a transfer it will hold the collateral in an escrow contract that borrows to repay the liquidity debt and then users can reclaim that position by approving the debt delegation again and calling the escrow contract to migrate the position. Note that the contracts now allow for migrating debt from one user to another given a permission even if the front end does not show it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djdmp","text":"What's the unique proposition?","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di2ml","text":"Kapan focuses on borrowers, which are the source of revenue for all lending protocols. While there are many supply side yield automation protocols, there is none for the borrow side, which I believe impacts the growth of lending providers and general on chain lending usage. The roadmap of Kapan is entirely based on borrower features and UX improvements and the aim is to be the go to place for routing borrowers to the protocol most suited to them. While I can't say it's extremely novel, there is nothing else with an expansive focus on borrowers and expanding their mobility and improving their experience will be greatly beneficial to the whole of the DeFi landscape.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sd66","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aktlj","text":"Why does the project need grants?","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rv3s","text":"As with anything else in DeFi with all the scams going around, having an actual full launch and usage before a trusted auditor weighing in on the project is impossible. I've been developing the project myself, but audits are incredibly expensive for me to take on. I don't want to go the VC route for the core infrastructure as this route does not allow me to do things the proper way and focus on user's experience and demands. Grants have been requested from lending protocols supported and networks to deploy and would help with the security audits and continued development of the cross chain features. I'm committed to delivering all the code eitherway, but the code being unaudited is a hard stop on any growth. While at this point there is an over-reliance on grants, there are some features planned like automation that would make sense to charge a fee. Nonetheless I think it's fair to fund the core infrastructure from grants and make it accessible to everyone without parastic fees. Most lending providers do not use upgradable proxies (which is understandable given they secure large amounts of money) so I do not expect a huge need to maintain the core infrastructure once in place. The code is structured in a way that allows easily adding more protocols or support for newer versions without having to majorly rereview everything. With the starknet deployment an even clearer \"instruction\" based pattern has emerged that is suitable for all kinds of protocols and should make maintenance elementary. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gp9s","text":"Strategic considerations","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c843e","text":"The project will allow both inflows and outflows. It is neutral in regards to lending providers and networks. Thus there is always going to be a risk of outflow. However I believe its better to have the tools, than not. At the end of the day rates are based on supply and demand so if the ecosystem is good at bringing liquidity (which so far it has been) there is no reason to believe this will be a net negative TVL wise. Having the Arbitrum DAO back the project, along with others and hopefully lending protocols should also be beneficial for security audit negotiations. While no matter what I'm committed to evolving the project on Arbitrum, having it backed by the DAO will certainly help a lot. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd92l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frfph","text":"Of course this being planned as a cross chain project does mean the alignment is not unique to Arbitrum and it might be a bit unfair if Arbitrum funds a lot of it while the rest free ride, but at the end debt refinancing is something that has existed for a very long time and I feel is a no brainer to be added to DeFi. And the value prop of this project grows with the more chains that are supported not only for the project itself, but in general for anybody included. Every network added means there are more channels through which borrowers can come and go. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":103,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8m4p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gtk6","text":"A note on general ecosystem alignment","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4uqu","text":"As I mentioned, I want the protocol to provide the tools that are not readily provided by other lending protocols and ensure new ones have them too. I hope that positioning in this \"infra\" place and not directly competing with anyone, projects in the Arbitrum ecosystem will be more keen to list the protocol as an official \"partner\" tool and bring it to their users or would be users attention. In general borrower mobility allows not only lending protocols to amplify their marketing results, but Arbitrum as a whole. There are some bits that are hard to structure as a partnership like liquidity sharing, due to it having to be on the source chain rather than the destination chain. If the project grows its possible that they can happen anyway to allow for huge amounts of debt to be transfered, as the limit for a transfer would be the available liquidity and there might even be a queue which is less than ideal, but its a good starting point.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"718mb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uea4","text":"Here are some screenshots from the current public deployed build (there are some bugs, but this is always the case for projects under active development):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69s9a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"98b2e","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0l7k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"511s3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lvmn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47b8h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":{}},{"key":"1po8c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"src":"https://ipfs.questbook.app:8080/ipfs/QmQyJkayda4w3fbLLYkp5wBeurhTAVALmBm25cGQX4gSzq","width":100,"height":0}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"src":"https://ipfs.questbook.app:8080/ipfs/QmX8LTqxB2Zm1L2xvHCJxStFM9RS66dUUvaWQy7LyzQTL7","width":100,"height":0}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"src":"https://ipfs.questbook.app:8080/ipfs/QmX1gbbdkpptMkaENZc5k7ZeAArLc3UvKkMRKExWk8yzLh","width":100,"height":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dcau9","text":"Project Description","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":19,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae81v","text":"Our proposal is to build a fully decentralized educational platform leveraging Arbitrum Stylus, designed for educators, blockchain developers, and protocols. This innovative platform consolidates all kinds of education into one secure, verifiable, and permanent on-chain resource hub, significantly enhancing teaching/course hosting experience, developer onboarding, streamlining educational resource management, and accelerating adoption of scalable blockchain products beyond regular web3 dApps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":27,"length":40,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":79,"length":15,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ul62","text":"Market Potential & Statistical Evidence","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":39,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brvik","text":"Blockchain Education Growth:
 The global blockchain education market was valued at $118.73 million in 2021, projected to reach $3.05 billion by 2030, at a CAGR of 43.94% (Source: A3Logics, 2023: https://www.a3logics.com/blog/blockchain-in-education).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":29,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":83,"length":23,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":127,"length":21,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":163,"length":6,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":179,"length":16,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":178,"length":15,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"6b4q5","text":"Blockchain Industry Spend on Education:
 Major blockchain protocols collectively invested over $200 million in educational initiatives, grants, hackathons, and dev-rel programs in 2022 alone (Source: CoinDesk Research, Gitcoin Analytics, Messari Reports:https://messari.io/report/state-of-crypto-education) .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":40,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":95,"length":12,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":200,"length":53,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":199,"length":54,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"egeg2","text":"Web2 Subscription Costs:
 Blockchain educational platforms typically spend between $25 to $75 per user per month on subscriptions to centralized Web2 platforms (e.g., 101 Blockchains pricing model). Our platform directly captures a significant share of this market by offering more secure, decentralized, and permanently accessible educational hosting without recurring Web2 costs.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":25,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":83,"length":29,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":166,"length":16,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":166,"length":16,"key":2}],"data":{}},{"key":"cc65g","text":"Why clear revenue potential.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ic76","text":"Showcases Arbitrum Stylus’s capabilities beyond standard, applications.fundingAsk: {"blocks":[{"key":"fqh7","text":"Celluloid Store is a decentralized platform for film writers to write, collaborate, and protect their screenplays. It enables blockchain-based IP ownership, encrypted storage (IPFS/Arweave), secure script sharing with access logs, and AI-generated storyboards. Built for the creator economy, it empowers writers to retain control over their work while leveraging modern AI and Web3 infrastructure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":15,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82cbs","text":"Signals is a new, open-source protocol currently in the early stages of development. It was born out of the Arbitrum x RnDAO Collabtech hackathon, where we won first place.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t0da","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12sn1","text":"The problem statement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":21,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3td8","text":"Many DAOs have robust governance and voting systems in place, however there is a common need to better understand the real desires of the community. Forum posts and upvotes can be brigaded or otherwise misleading, and decisions made by voting alone can be heavily swayed by large token holders.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s82n","text":"Signals aims to solve these problems by allowing community members to lock up their governance tokens in support of initiatives. The opportunity cost of these lockups will filter out weakly-held opinions, and by giving greater weight to lockups that are committed to for a longer time, even small token holders can have their voice represented.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0nl2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccqac","text":"How it works","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":12,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"facsq","text":"A Signals “board” is created and configured for a particular DAO, specifying eligibility requirements, which tokens will be used, and other aspects.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frtbj","text":"DAO members submit initiatives that they think are important for the community to get behind. These can be anything from vague concepts to detailed proposals. The DAO is free to decide what format is most useful to them.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kojk","text":"Other participants can lock up their governance tokens in support of the initiatives they agree with. Locking up tokens for a longer time is counted as a larger amount of support, allowing even small token holders to have an equal voice.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cja7","text":"Once an initiative has reached a preconfigured threshold of support, the DAO can officially “accept” the initiative which signals an acknowledgement that the community has reached alignment.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j46","text":"When an initiative is accepted, all tokens are unlocked and returned to their owners. Unpopular initiatives will eventually expire and unlock as well, however the opportunity cost means users will only want to support initiatives they believe will have a strong chance of being accepted in a timely manner.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f994","text":"Many aspects of the protocol can be configured and tailored to the specific needs of the DAO, making it a very flexible and powerful tool in surfacing community sentiment outside of/in addition to the voting process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ccrbk","text":"Yapper AI is a community engagement and rewards protocol built on Arbitrum that incentivizes users to promote ecosystem projects through high-quality content. Users earn native YAP tokens by creating and sharing promotional content—measured using AI models that evaluate engagement and relevance. Participants also provide liquidity by depositing USDC, earning additional rewards and staking yields. Protocols within the ecosystem can collaborate by funding campaigns, which are distributed to contributors based on their impact. Yapper AI drives community growth, boosts protocol visibility, and enhances Arbitrum’s presence across social platforms in a fun, gamified way.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":9,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":177,"length":10,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rkrs","text":"RheoLayer is a Proof-of-Engagement (PoE) rewards protocol that leverages EigenLayer restaking to create Sybil-resistant incentives for DeFi, DAO, and NFT projects on Arbitrum. The protocol introduces an on-chain, verifiable engagement system where users must restake assets to participate in quests, while EigenLayer's Autonomous Verifiable Services (AVS) validate engagement to ensure fairness. This approach eliminates bot-driven engagement farming, enhances long-term participation, and establishes a trust-minimized rewards mechanism for the Arbitrum ecosystem.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":15,"length":42,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":203,"length":38,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":319,"length":36,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":504,"length":33,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5t1qt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9hmt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"4nb5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"src":"https://ipfs.questbook.app:8080/ipfs/QmXGG68iJFiVgSJMoxL93P8doNMbM2wjnhMUiyX3cFCge1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3a9a3","text":"Through working closely with our users, we've identified a critical need: objective support in identifying agreement with an organization - how much should someone be paid, what’s their roles and responsibilities. Defining a clear agreement with an organizations is difficult and yet crucial to fair and effective compensation. Collabberry currently brings contributor agreements onchain and enables decentralized compensation based on those agreements and 360° reviews. By leveraging the wisdom of the crowd, we generate compensation packages that reflect the actual value delivered. The next step in our product evolution is developing an AI-powered Agreements Agent—a module that helps contributors and organizations define clear, fair agreements from the outset. This feature expands our existing tool and addresses a major friction point in early-stage collaboration. The core product is already in use, and this next step will help address one of the biggest remaining pain points for adoption.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gee8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38vop","text":"Collabberry's MVP has been built with funding from Arbitrum Questbook grant 2.0.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j3d5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jpvf","text":"Completion report: https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/collabberry-completion-report-questbook-season-3/28425","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

applications.fundingAsk: {"blocks":[{"key":"78u9a","text":"We are building a Developer SDK & Integration Library for Timeboost on Arbitrum. This tool will abstract and simplify the complex auction, bidding, and express lane transaction processes, enabling developers to seamlessly integrate Timeboost functionalities into their decentralized applications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqdnt","text":"Gbawo (http://gbawo.com) is a remittance platform that uses stablecoins and AI in the background to send and receive money globally at the same speed as sending a message on WhatsApp. Funds move from the fiat in your bank account to the recipient's wallet in seconds, and this is done using an AI agent on WhatsApp(https://whatsapp.com/).   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":7,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":23,"length":1,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":306,"length":9,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":336,"length":1,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"key":0},{"offset":305,"length":9,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"919vh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d33d","text":"Gbawo Flow (IRL user scenario)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":30,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"caanm","text":"If David in the US needs to send money to Pranav in India, all he asks for is Pranav’s exchange (e.g CoinDCX, Bitget, etc.) and the exchange ID (can be an email or user ID).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":87,"length":8,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":132,"length":11,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lpts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b008h","text":"David initiates the transaction with the AI agent, and the USD is debited from his bank account. Pranav receives USDT on his exchange account account and off-ramps to a local bank account.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bps95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hna7","text":"Also, several regular fintech and offramp apps (Grey(https://grey.co/), Capa(https://capa.fi/), Accrue(https://useaccrue.com/), Noblocks(https://noblocks.xyz/)) in emerging markets allow users to hold stables and convert them to local currency. We'll use them interchangeably with exchanges because they’re simpler and even more popular.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":48,"length":5,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":69,"length":1,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":72,"length":5,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":93,"length":1,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":96,"length":7,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":125,"length":1,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":128,"length":9,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"offset":158,"length":1,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":48,"length":4,"key":2},{"offset":72,"length":4,"key":3},{"offset":96,"length":6,"key":4},{"offset":128,"length":8,"key":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"abm9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5nuh","text":"Technical Implementation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":24,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt6mu","text":"On a low-level, when a user wants to send money, they start by chatting with the agent. The agent asks for the recipient ID, which must come from a partnered wallet or exchange. Using this ID, the system finds the recipient’s verified wallet address through the exchange’s API.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":111,"length":12,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":226,"length":23,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s9ps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tduc","text":"Once the ID is confirmed, the sender approves the transaction using an open banking service. This makes sure they have enough funds and that everything is secure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":37,"length":24,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6agtf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avr4m","text":"After that, the system processes the transaction, and sends the stablecoin equivalent to the recipient’s wallet. Once the transfer is complete, both the sender and recipient get a confirmation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":64,"length":21,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bajn2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"693r2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"aekrj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coi4b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8giu","text":"Why This Structure?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":19,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82esj","text":"Existing remittance apps like Lemfi(https://lemfi.com/) and Wise(https://wise.com/) expand slowly per country because of local regulations and they need to handle actual cash as floats in multiple countries and currencies - - both in the sender’s and receiver’s countries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sd0s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsoa9","text":"In contrast, we will have a single float in stablecoins that we’d use to pay the recipient. This makes us global by default. Also, we're not dealing with regulations because the exchanges in the recipient countries are already compliant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"LINK","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"href":"http://gbawo.com","url":"http://gbawo.com/"}},"1":{"type":"LINK","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"href":"https://whatsapp.com/","url":"https://whatsapp.com/"}},"2":{"type":"LINK","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"href":"https://grey.co/","url":"https://grey.co/"}},"3":{"type":"LINK","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"href":"https://capa.fi/","url":"https://capa.fi/"}},"4":{"type":"LINK","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"href":"https://useaccrue.com/","url":"https://useaccrue.com/"}},"5":{"type":"LINK","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"href":"https://noblocks.xyz/","url":"https://noblocks.xyz/"}},"6":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"src":"https://ipfs.questbook.app:8080/ipfs/QmTXPeKMGdzCCSHS2uJ9dMD95tNnDrUsKc2L868p89tCMB"}}}}

applications.fundingAsk: {"blocks":[{"key":"av5o5","text":"ArbiHR is a blockchain-powered HR software designed to streamline recruitment, payroll, and performance tracking for SMEs and enterprises. applications.fundingAsk: {"blocks":[{"key":"sp0o","text":"Stogram is a decentralized social media platform designed to prioritize user privacy, monetization, and transparency. Our mission is to empower both content creators and consumers through innovative monetization features while addressing the real-world issue of centralized data ownership. Stogram ensures that all user data is stored entirely on-chain making our platform truly decentralized and censorship-resistant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kqep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccmqm","text":"Key features include an in-app and on-chain username minting service , allowing users to establish and own their digital identity , Stogram also allows users to post their content as NFTs . Additionally, we’ve recently introduced a donation feature that enables users to directly support and motivate their favorite creators.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf6ct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p3ia","text":"To further enhance monetization, we’re developing a staking feature and prediction marketplace. Staking will allow users to stake on the posts of their favorite creators and earn interest from the staking pool. A portion of the interest goes to the post’s creator, and in return, users gain access to premium content from that creator. Whereas prediction market will let anyone launch/post their own game and be a meditor of the bets being put on their game and earn a commision for every bets placed on the game. In short Polls but advanced and monetized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

applications.fundingAsk: {"blocks":[{"key":"5kd71","text":"ArbiPulse is an innovative, real-time analytics platform built on Arbitrum that transforms raw blockchain data into actionable insights. By leveraging the Arbiscan API, our MCP server continuously ingests and processes live data, which is then contextualized and analyzed using Claude AI. The platform delivers intuitive RESTful APIs and a user-friendly dashboard, providing developers, traders, and researchers with the tools to monitor trends, detect anomalies, and make informed decisions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":9,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkkhe","text":"Proposal Aims & Scope","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":21,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akbfj","text":"Clear End Deliverable:\n Our goal is to build a fully functional protocol toolkit that integrates real-time data ingestion, AI-powered analysis, and comprehensive visualization. The deliverable will include both backend services for data processing and a front-end dashboard, ensuring a complete, deployable solution for users.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":23,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fd70","text":"Alignment with Arbitrum’s Ethos:\n The project is designed with Arbitrum's core values in mind:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":33,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6guf5","text":"Scalability: The architecture will support high-volume, real-time data streams without compromising performance.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":12,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjh8d","text":"User-Focused Design: The dashboard and APIs are built for simplicity and usability, enabling even non-technical users to access and understand blockchain trends.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":20,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56ruf","text":"Innovation: By integrating cutting-edge AI with blockchain analytics, the platform sets a new standard for data-driven decision-making in the Arbitrum ecosystem.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":11,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fitg4","text":"In summary, ArbiPulse aims to deliver a comprehensive, user-friendly tool that not only meets the technical demands of real-time blockchain analysis but also drives innovation and broader ecosystem engagement on Arbitrum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":12,"length":9,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ddc2","text":"The Arbitrum Agent Kit is an innovative, open-source AI-powered blockchain agent toolkit tailored specifically for Arbitrum, significantly simplifying blockchain development and interaction. By integrating advanced AI capabilities through LangChain.js with Arbitrum's extensive features—RPC APIs (via Alchemy), subgraph analytics (via Alchemy and Snapshot), protocol integrations (Uniswap V3, SushiSwap), NFT marketplace support (OpenSea, Treasure), and advanced interactions with Stylus (WASM smart contracts)—this toolkit dramatically reduces technical complexity and accelerates the adoption of AI-driven blockchain solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":18,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":215,"length":36,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":287,"length":22,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":311,"length":45,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":358,"length":45,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":405,"length":43,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":454,"length":33,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":524,"length":70,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63f2q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fk88","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"35nvd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0ai9","text":"Detailed Use Cases:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":19,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tfto","text":"Automated DeFi Management:AI agents can autonomously perform token swaps, liquidity management, and yield optimization across platforms like Uniswap V3 and SushiSwap.
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":25,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vsto","text":"NFT Market Automation:Users can automatically buy, sell, or monitor NFTs on platforms like OpenSea and Treasure based on market conditions and personalized strategies.
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":21,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9npt","text":"Intelligent DAO Governance:Agents assist DAO participants by summarizing active proposals, voting automatically based on predefined criteria, and analyzing voting history and delegation via Snapshot integration.
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":26,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88evq","text":"Real-Time Blockchain Analytics:Developers and end-users gain access to instant, detailed insights on token prices, liquidity pool statistics, NFT sales, and DAO voting patterns.
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":30,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rnhe","text":"Arbitrum Stylus Contract Integration:Developers can leverage powerful WASM smart contracts, interact seamlessly with existing deployed Rust-based contracts, enabling sophisticated computational tasks directly on-chain.
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":36,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kmtt","text":"Key Features & Technical Benefits:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":34,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dv0m","text":"AI-Blockchain Interface:Uses LangChain.js to translate natural language into precise blockchain commands, enabling complex interactions without extensive blockchain expertise.
","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":23,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tfsk","text":"Full Alchemy RPC Method Coverage:Comprehensive implementation of blockchain RPC methods, enabling robust account, transaction, and event management.
","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":32,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g644","text":"Advanced Analytics & Subgraphs:Integration with Alchemy's and Snapshot's subgraphs to provide powerful real-time and historical blockchain data analytics.

The requested grant will support focused development of the core transaction-level trust primitives, contract modularization, documentation, and deployment validation on Arbitrum One. applications.name: Decentralized Infrastructure Tooling for Arbitrum Node and Orbit Chain Operation
applications.grantAmount:
We are requesting a grant of $150,000 USD (or equivalent in ARB) to support the development and delivery of reusable infrastructure tooling for Arbitrum node and Orbit chain operations.

This funding will be used to:

Deliver standardized Arbitrum One and Orbit chain deployment templates

Build automated deployment and lifecycle management tooling

Implement monitoring and observability primitives

Validate decentralized execution on non-cloud hardware

Publish open-source documentation and reference implementations

The requested grant funds a clearly scoped Arbitrum-native MVP and does not represent the full cost of the broader platform, which is already supported by internal resources and operating revenue. This approach minimizes risk to the DAO while producing durable, ecosystem-wide tooling that remains useful beyond the grant period.

applications.name: Gravitas Protocol
applications.grantAmount:
We are requesting a grant of $50,000 (in ARB tokens) to complete the deployment, integration, and optimization of Gravitas Protocol on Arbitrum One mainnet.

The funds will transform the existing MVP into a production-ready liquidity automation layer that serves developers, DEXs, and institutional liquidity providers across the Arbitrum ecosystem.

Approximately 70% of the budget will be dedicated to core product development and security, with the remaining funds supporting SDK/API tools, infrastructure, and transparent DAO reporting.

The proposed allocation is as follows:

Development & Smart Contract Deployment ($25,000):
This covers finalizing the deterministic routing logic, enhancing contract modularity, and deploying the fully verified Gravitas Protocol on Arbitrum One.
Deliverable: Functional mainnet contracts integrated with Uniswap, Camelot, and SushiSwap.

Security Testing & Optimization ($10,000):
Used for internal stress testing, fuzzing, simulation, and preparation for external audits (Code4rena or Hacken).
Deliverable: Verified performance under load, optimized routing latency (<5 seconds), and public audit readiness.

SDK & API Development ($8,000):
Funding the development of SDK packages and REST APIs that allow DEXs, aggregators, and developers to easily integrate Gravitas routing logic.
Deliverable: Public SDK repository with documentation and example integrations.

Infrastructure & Operations ($3,000):
Covers RPC node hosting, relayers, analytics infrastructure, and uptime monitoring.
Deliverable: Operational mainnet environment with over 90% uptime and performance dashboards.

Documentation & DAO Reporting ($4,000):
Supports preparation of the updated whitepaper, open-source documentation, and milestone-based KPI reports for the Arbitrum DAO.
Deliverable: Published documentation and transparent public progress reports.

In total, the requested $50,000 (in ARB) grant will fund the completion of the Gravitas Protocol’s mainnet deployment, SDK/API release, and developer infrastructure — establishing it as a core liquidity automation layer for the Arbitrum ecosystem, enhancing cross-DEX capital efficiency and driving ecosystem growth.

100%
Focus on Security and Core Infrastructure.

Unlike traditional data platforms reliant on APIs and centralized endpoints, our SDK eliminates intermediaries, offering a decentralized and transparent solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am83e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9h89","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu3ge","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"k1q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ri5s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkuo3","text":"Stylus contracts will incorporate Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) via Microsoft SEAL, on-device zkProof generation, and on-chain SQLite databases. Developed in Rust and C++, the SDK allows encrypted data to be processed in smart contracts without revealing private information. This enables privacy-preserving real-world applications such as energy and traffic flow optimization and environmental monitoring, all with guaranteed data confidentiality.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a60q","text":"The diagram below illustrates the architecture we’re building and the tools we’ll add to Stylus, all of which will be open-source for developers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3rma","text":"SQLite Database on Stylus Smart Contracts: Integrates SQLite3 for efficient, lightweight on-chain data management.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":43,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2novl","text":"Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE): Enables secure, privacy-preserving processing of SQLite data on-chain using Microsoft SEAL.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":35,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgk1k","text":"zkProofs for Data Validation: Verifies real-world data directly with zkproof generation directly on-device and stored on-chain","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":30,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fj7mg","text":"IoT Device Access: Allows IoT devices to interact with Stylus smart contracts without APIs or oracles, ensuring deterministic outcomes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":18,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1v90i","text":"These tools go beyond the needs of our project, unlocking new possibilities for the Arbitrum ecosystem. With this funding, we aim to create a suite of open-source resources that empower developers to build their own innovative projects.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3aaf1","text":"Additionally, the SDK supports the creation of modular “City-Chains” on Arbitrum Orbit, empowering local stakeholders and communities to leverage Web3 liquidity for localized Smart City and decentralized services. This aligns with Arbitrum’s goals of scalability and decentralization while enabling practical, community-focused applications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":55,"length":13,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qno0","text":"Modern Society Labs is all about creating tools that drive economic development and financial inclusion. For the Arbitrum Web3 community, this approach opens the door to entirely new protocols. These tools would bridge real-world data and blockchain technology, offering tangible use cases that expand beyond speculative investments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17a34","text":"That said, this proposal is mainly about developing an open-source SDK that lets anyone create a data layer of off-chain information for use with Arbitrum Mainnet or Orbit Chains. Use cases include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ps1i","text":"For Local Institutions: Giving governments, NGOs, and policymakers access to privacy-preserving, real-time data for smarter decisions. For example, using this data to improve public services, allocate resources efficiently, and plan for economic growth in underserved communities. (See 2. for examples)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":23,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hdo2","text":"For Web3 Investors: Opening up real-world asset opportunities like business lending, auto and health insurance through DeFi. This bridges global liquidity with local communities, unlocking funding and economic opportunities. For Arbitrum investors, it’s a transparent way to access real-world financial services while supporting underserved areas. (See 2. for examples)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":19,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eieqp","text":"Here are examples of how our tools could benefit different stakeholders:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7ubi","text":"For Governments & Stakeholders (Smart City Data and Services):","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i7ag","text":"Example 1: Deploy intelligent traffic systems that share mobility data between public and private transit providers.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6vk6","text":"Benefit: Reduces congestion and emissions while improving public safety and transportation infrastructure.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5864p","text":"Example 2: Use real-time health data, like opioid levels in wastewater, to predict and prevent overdoses (similar to Cary, N.C.).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ci5ae","text":"Benefit: Provides hyper-local insights and enables tailored interventions for community health challenges.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"430qd","text":"For dApp Makers & Developers (DePIN & the Machine Economy):","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e09n","text":"Example 1: Create dynamically adjusting smart contracts for small business loans, tied to real-time financial data, and tokenize these loans for RWA trading.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lq94","text":"Benefit: Monetizes real-world assets, offering transparent, encrypted loan health data directly to on-chain investors, eliminating the need for APIs or oracles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj7t1","text":"Example 2: Build decentralized auto insurance and DMV services powered by real-time vehicle data.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82ffu","text":"Benefit: Gives Web3 investors access to new financial products tied to real-world services, diversifying their portfolios beyond speculative markets or staking yields.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr7dl","text":"Our approach builds on what platforms like ZenCity have started. While ZenCity uses social media sentiment data to serve 140+ cities and has raised $100M+, we’re expanding this concept (3). By integrating IoT data, machine-to-economy frameworks, and dApps with an SQL-backed Arbitrum off-chain infrastructure, we aim to create a more comprehensive and impactful ecosystem for both local communities and the Web3 space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":185,"length":3,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1htkh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aa6ud","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"src":"https://ipfs.questbook.app:8080/ipfs/QmZhDQkZhmWNVv3i5NmqHCrFbSBB7KCfpU3J45yWPcohja"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"src":"https://ipfs.questbook.app:8080/ipfs/QmTsoUL2HrApfw4eAZEifQXS4dQquCPGHYuxzXv1D9tH2h"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9tn2","text":"DAppXplorer is a comprehensive analytics dashboard tailored for Stylus dApps on Arbitrum. It integrates directly with Arbitrum node APIs and blockchain explorers to collect critical performance metrics such as transaction speeds, gas usage, error rates, and contract interactions. The platform provides developers with both real-time monitoring and historical trend analysis through intuitive, single-chart visualizations built using matplotlib. With a robust custom alerting system, developers can quickly detect anomalies, potential security threats, or performance degradations. Its scalable, modular architecture not only supports simultaneous monitoring of multiple dApps but also facilitates future enhancements and integrations, making it an essential tool for optimizing dApp performance and driving ecosystem innovation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8a8s","text":"SaSa games (currently pomaprotocol) is a gaming tournament & engagement platform that rewards players for playing, competing, and sharing their engagement. It provides an automated and scalable engagement system for Web2 and Web3 games, in which players can join tournaments and challenges, win rewards and interact with gaming communities through an engage-to-earn model.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cofk","text":"Currently the features include a range of community quests and activities. Our next step is to evolve the platform’s focus toward gaming tournaments and competitions, improve scalability, tracking of game data, and deeper blockchain integrations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

applications.fundingAsk: {"blocks":[{"key":"3pdbe","text":"CertiChain is a blockchain-based platform that empowers universities to issue and verify academic credentials as NFTs, ensuring authenticity, security, and accessibility. By leveraging Arbitrum’s scalable and cost-efficient Layer 2 solution, CertiChain streamlines credential management, reduces fraud, and enhances trust in academic records. Our minimum viable product (MVP) is live at dcnweb.vercel.app, demonstrating core functionality for issuing and verifying NFT-based certificates. This project aims to revolutionize academic credentialing by combining blockchain technology with real-world utility","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":387,"length":17,"key":0}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"LINK","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"href":"https://dcnweb.vercel.app","rel":"noopener noreferrer nofollow","target":"_blank","url":"https://dcnweb.vercel.app/"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfa7b","text":"stylus-opt is a command-line tool that empowers developers building on Arbitrum Stylus to maximize the performance and efficiency of their smart contracts by providing an integrated profiler and optimizer specifically for Stylus contracts. It can measure precise gas (ink) consumption of functions and execution paths, pinpointing gas-heavy operations, and then automatically optimize the compiled WASM bytecode to reduce size and improve execution efficiency. In short, stylus-opt is a one-stop solution to analyze where your Stylus contract spends gas and ink, and to apply advanced optimizations that make your contract smaller, cheaper, and faster on Arbitrum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":71,"length":15,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":182,"length":22,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":247,"length":37,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":362,"length":49,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":516,"length":45,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":623,"length":28,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61je3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm3en","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9kl8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vlbs","text":"Core Components","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e9gc","text":"1. Profiling Module (Gas & Performance Measurement)","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7cvd","text":"The profiler leverages Stylus's unique gas accounting system, which uses fractional units called ink (1 EVM gas = 10,000 ink) to measure execution costs with high precision. Key features include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":97,"length":3,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jei7","text":"Function-level gas analysis: applications.grantAmount:
USD 40,000

The standard commercial value of the Institutional Summit co-sponsorship is EUR 40,000 (approximately USD 48,000). However, given Arbitrum’s sustained involvement and strategic collaboration across previous MERGE editions, we are applying a direct reduction of USD 8,000 on the standard price.

In addition, and as part of this grant-supported initiative, the activation is upgraded beyond the standard package. While the regular Institutional Summit co-sponsorship includes 3 curated B2B meetings, this proposal expands that scope to 10 curated B2B meetings with highly relevant institutional stakeholders, selected based on strategic relevance and adoption potential.

applications.grantAmount:
We are requesting a grant of USD 44,925 to support the execution of the HackBalam initiative.

The requested grant will be allocated to cover the full scope of the project, including:

Educational workshops and training delivery (instructor costs, content production, and community management).

Development and hosting of the HackBalam learning platform, including infrastructure for hands-on labs.

Technical infrastructure for smart contract security labs and CTF challenges (servers, nodes, deployments, and gas fees).

Organization and execution of the first Web3 LATAM Capture The Flag (CTF) focused on Arbitrum, including:

CTF platform and infrastructure

Challenge design and mentors

Participant support, prizes, and scholarships

Venue, logistics, and event operations

Production of open-source educational materials and security challenges.

Impact reporting and transparency deliverables for the Arbitrum ecosystem.

This funding will enable HackBalam to move from early-stage planning to full execution, delivering measurable improvements in developer education, security awareness, and talent development within the Arbitrum ecosystem.

applications.name: OnChain Revolution Arbitrum Grant Proposal
applications.grantAmount:
Requested Grant

We are requesting a grant of $60,000 USD equivalent from the Arbitrum Foundation.

This funding will be allocated to:

Production & Operations – professional livestreams, editing, and design

Content Expansion & Marketing – paid distribution campaigns to maximize reach of Arbitrum narratives

Professional Clipping Team – dedicated editors creating 3–5 daily viral-ready short-form clips

Community Growth & Incentives – giveaways, AMAs, and engagement campaigns tied to Arbitrum DeFi and Gaming

Guest Outreach & Partnerships – featuring DeFi builders and gaming studios

Equipment & Infrastructure – hardware upgrades for higher-quality content

Grant Structure:

Total: $60,000

Duration: 6 months

Disbursement: Milestone-based (20% Month 1, 30% Months 2–3, 30% Months 4–5, 20% Month 6 upon final report)

This grant will directly fund the creation of 24+ Arbitrum-focused livestreams, 500+ viral-ready clips, 20+ project spotlights, and multiple community campaigns, ensuring Arbitrum DeFi and Gaming achieve broader visibility and adoption.

applications.name: BUIDLmode | Rollup Radio: Arbitrum Ecosystem Podcast - a community for builders.
applications.grantAmount:
Requested Grant: $10,350 USD for 3 months of podcast production and ecosystem amplification by a two person core team.
What the Budget Covers:
Research & Preparation – Deep dives into projects, founders, and developers to craft accurate, meaningful questions.


Interview & Storytelling – Narrative driven episodes highlighting both the technical vision and the human story.


Production & Hosting – High quality recording, editing, and publishing across platforms.


Marketing & Graphics – Creation of visual assets, short form clips, and promotional campaigns for X, TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube.


Outreach & BD – Guest coordination, scheduling, and ecosystem partnership management.


Operational Coverage – A two-person team handling every step (research, hosting, editing, graphics, marketing, outreach, production) ensures consistent, professional content without additional overhead.


Additional Note: A portion of the grant will support a part-time hire to assist with rollout planning and distribution, ensuring maximum reach and impact.
Efficiency: This budget represents a lean, cost effective model, delivering 12 weekly episodes, 60+ short-form clips, and ongoing social amplification over 3 months for less than the cost of a single full-time ecosystem hire.

applications.name: Crave the Code: A Developer-First Hackathon Empowering Builders on Arbitrum
applications.grantAmount:
We are requesting a grant of $5,000 to $7,500 (in USDC or ARB) to support the execution of Crave the Code, our 8-hour online hackathon aimed at onboarding over 2,500 new developers into the Arbitrum ecosystem. This grant will directly contribute to developer onboarding, project deployment, and brand visibility for Arbitrum across student and early-stage builder communities.

The requested funds will be allocated across key areas to maximize impact:

$2,500 for prizes and bounties to reward the best Arbitrum-based projects

$1,000 to support mentor stipends and developer help desk operations during the event

$1,000 for marketing, community engagement, and outreach across 50+ college tech communities

$1,000 to cover platform tools, infrastructure, judging panels, and submission management

$500–$1,000 for creating and distributing beginner-friendly Arbitrum learning resources and workshops

This funding will ensure that the hackathon is inclusive, well-executed, and optimized to deliver real project deployments, developer education, and lasting ecosystem growth for Arbitrum.

We are open to milestone-based disbursement and will provide full transparency through a detailed post-event report, including participation data, project outcomes, and ecosystem engagement metrics.

applications.fundingAsk:
{"blocks":[{"key":"fkn7p","text":"Urbe Campus is an educational initiative developed by urbe.eth, a community of over 800 Web3 builders based in Rome. The primary goal of Urbe Campus is to onboard and educate new developers into the Web3 ecosystem, focusing specifically on blockchain fundamentals, smart contract development, and decentralized applications.

Since its launch, we have hosted seven successful editions (two of them supported by previous Arbitrum Grants), onboarding over 220 developers into the ecosystem. These bootcamps have been held in collaboration with renowned coding schools like 42 Coding School and major Ethereum-focused hackathons & Conferences, such as ETHRome, ETHWarsaw, ETHGlobal, and Devcon.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5809f","text":"The format consists of structured, hands-on bootcamps held in person, typically organized just before major Ethereum-related hackathons. Each bootcamp provides intensive training, practical mentorship from experienced developers, and direct opportunities to apply these new skills in hackathons immediately following the course. This integrated learning experience significantly reduces entry barriers, encouraging participants to confidently engage with Arbitrum and the broader Web3 community.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c5p4","text":"In 2025, we plan to host two major editions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ht2e","text":"Urbe Village Edition in Rome (October 6th to 15th), featuring an extended 8-day bootcamp.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cc27j","text":"Devconnect Edition (November 2025, location and dates TBD), featuring a 5-day bootcamp integrated within Devconnect.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7htc","text":"Additionally, through a dedicated residency program, Arbitrum will have the opportunity to sponsor selected students in the Urbe Village edition, providing accommodations and further supporting their Web3 journey.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ka6m","text":"urbe.eth (https://urbe.build/) is a vibrant community of Web3 builders, based in Rome. Founded to counteract narratives that focus heavily on financial speculation, urbe.eth highlights blockchain technology's innovative potential to enhance daily life. Our goal is to onboard the next generation of Web3 builders. The community has grown to 718 members on Discord, consisting primarily of builders working on their own startups or Web3 projects.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":10,"length":19,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":10,"length":19,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"ep0u0","text":"Below is a breakdown of all the initiatives that we have organized in 3years of community activities.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2v06","text":"ETHRome 2023 hackathon: Privacy & Governance tracks, the first and only international Ethereum hackathon in Italy, attended by 132 hackers and 250+ people. Report: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1cC5B3IfVrbW0exgS6BYELzPpxxAppuuBXMwpy8c2
